channel.title: math.RT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.RT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Some isomorphisms between exceptional W-algebras
item.description: arXiv:2408.08371v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove some isomorphisms between exceptional W-algebras associated with exceptional simple Lie algebras.
item.dc:creator: Jethro van Ekeren, Shigenori Nakatsuka

item.title: Homology of Segre products of Boolean and subspace lattices
item.description: arXiv:2408.08421v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Segre products of posets were defined by Bj\"orner and Welker [J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 198(1-3), 43--55 (2005)]. We investigate the $t$-fold Segre product of the Boolean lattice $B_n$ and the subspace lattice $B_n(q)$. The case $t=2$ was considered by Yifei Li in [Alg. Comb. 6 (2), 457--469, 2023]. We describe how to construct an EL-labeling for the $t$-fold Segre product $P^{(t)}=P\circ \cdots \circ P$ ($t$ factors) from an EL-labeling of a pure poset $P$. We develop an extension of the product Frobenius characteristic defined by Li to examine the action of the $t$-fold direct product of the symmetric group on the homology of rank-selected subposets of $B_n^{(t)}$, giving an explicit formula for the decomposition into irreducibles for the homology of the full poset. We show that the stable principal specialisation of the associated Frobenius characteristics coincides with the corresponding rank-selected invariants for the subspace lattice.
item.dc:creator: Yifei Li, Sheila Sundaram

item.title: Denominators in Lusztig's asymptotic Hecke algebra via the Plancherel formula
item.description: arXiv:2110.07148v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $\tilde{W}$ be an extended affine Weyl group, $\mathbf{H}$ be the corresponding affine Hecke algebra over the ring $\mathbb{C}[\mathbf{q}^\frac{1}{2}, \mathbf{q}^{-\frac{1}{2}}]$, and $J$ be Lusztig's asymptotic Hecke algebra, viewed as a based ring with basis $\{t_w\}$. Viewing $J$ as a subalgebra of the $(\mathbf{q}^{-\frac{1}{2}})$-adic completion of $\mathbf{H}$ via Lusztig's map $\phi$, we use Harish-Chandra's Plancherel formula for $p$-adic groups to show that the coefficient of $T_x$ in $t_w$ is a rational function of $\mathbf{q}$, with denominator depending only on the two-sided cell containing $w$, and dividing a power of the Poincar\'{e} polynomial of the finite Weyl group. As an application, we conjecture that these denominators encode more detailed information about the failure of the Kazhdan-Lusztig classification at roots of the Poincar\'{e} polynomial than is currently known. Along the way, we show that upon specializing $\mathbf{q}=q>1$, the map from $J$ to the Harish-Chandra Schwartz algebra is injective. As an application of injectivity, we give a novel criterion for an Iwahori-spherical representation to have fixed vectors under a larger parahoric subgroup in terms of its Kazhdan-Lusztig parameter.
item.dc:creator: Stefan Dawydiak

item.title: Simple Vertex Algebras Arising From Congruence Subgroups
item.description: arXiv:2211.10090v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Chiral de Rham complex introduced by Malikov et al. in 1998, is a sheaf of vertex algebras on any complex analytic manifold or non-singular algebraic variety. Starting from the vertex algebra of global sections of chiral de Rham complex on the upper half plane, we consider the subspace of $\Gamma$-invariant sections that are meromorphic at the cusps. The space is again a vertex operator algebra, with a linear basis consisting of lifting formulas of meromorphic modular forms. We will describe two types of lifting formulas, and generalize the Rankin-Cohen bracket to the meromorphic modular forms. As an application, we will show that the vertex algebras constructed by congruence subgroups are simple.
item.dc:creator: Xuanzhong Dai, Bailin Song
